revised_title: Mount Vesuvius Eruption and Ashfall in the Archipelago
tldr: In 1665, a letter reported the raining of ashes in the Archipelago due to the eruption of Mount Vesuvius. The ashfall was observed by multiple ships, and the ashes were found to be the same across different locations. This event happened over 30 years ago and was documented to prevent the details from being lost.
